JobFullDesc: Microsoft 365 (M365) continues to be a significant driver of Microsoft’s success across the commercial landscape. The FastTrack service offerings help customers successfully deploy and drive user adoption of M365 solutions. When customers purchase eligible M365 licenses, the FastTrack benefit is included at no additional cost for the life of their subscriptions. The FastTrack team helps customers enable more effective teamwork, migrate data, and protect their organizations from cybersecurity threats and keep devices and apps up to date.Within the broader FastTrack framework, the FastTrack Ready Partner (FRP) program (https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/partners/fasttrack) drives high-touch engagement with select, highly proficient partners to deliver the FastTrack benefit and value-added services to M365 customers. The FRP program motion enables scale and increased velocity to business goals through a robust, mutually beneficial ecosystem of Microsoft FastTrack, FRPs and customers.The Partner Community and Experiences (PCX) team is responsible for driving partner satisfaction by creating and managing processes to make the Partner experience easier, reducing friction and increasing transparency. We are hiring a Program Manager to drive key business goals focused on partner readiness, communications, and documentation (RCD).ResponsibilitiesAs a Program Manager in the PCX-RCD team you will:Provide day to day management of the RCD operations and creative team.Curate readiness materials within and beyond FastTrack to provide Program Partners a one-stop-shop of training and resources to drive customer health and program success.Provide Partners timely and relevant high-quality communications to ensure awareness of key resources and changes to the program or how to deliver the benefit.Provide opportunities for Partners to learn and connect with the program team and each other through events such as:Partner program webinarsOffice hours eventsCommunity-building eventsProvide Partners reliable, accurate, relevant, and current guidance including but not limited to:Knowledge articlesTraining videosSupport the global partner community by providing region-specific content such as localized documentation.Provide prescriptive, persona-based partner journeys to facilitate effective navigation through partner content.Manage the PCX-RCD backlog effectively prioritizing and delivering work items based on submissions including but not limited to:Partner feedbackInternal feedbackRCD incidents/bugsStandard maintenance/operationsSeek out and deliver continuous improvements to the systems and processes used to deliver PCX-RCD including but not limited to:M365 Specialty Partner HubKnowledge BaseFRP YammerNews and Alerts BlogsPartner NewslettersPartner Learning Management SystemPartner Events Platform QualificationsYou have a passion for driving customer (partner) delight. You focus on clarity and transparency in communications. You implement solutions that are simple, scalable, and sustainable. You have managed and delivered projects with various teams in matrixed organizations, while influencing business, engineering, and operations teams not directly within your span of control to deliver effective solutions.You do the above with aplomb but with a measure of humility, recognizing that you do not always know it all. You are a team player and recognize healthy team dynamics as a pre-requisite to successful business outcomes. You do not hesitate to roll up your sleeves and help the team…no task is beneath you.You are familiar with Microsoft’s partner ecosystem and ideally know FRP and other Microsoft partner programs.Core Qualifications:10+ years of professional experience.5+ years of experience in program or projectmanagement,leading complex initiativesComfortable with ambiguity while being able to create clarity for your team to achieve results.Self-starter with the ability to own and drive projects/efforts with minimal supervision.Ability to negotiate with and influence other internal organizations to drive for a shared goal.Proficiency with Azure DevOps (ADO)Great interpersonal skills to be able to successfully communicate with and present to diverse stakeholders and audiences at various levels within the organization.Strong written and verbal communication skills.Strong presentation skills.Bachelor’s degree in business or related field. Preferred Qualifications:Knowledge of the FastTrack program and FastTrack approach and be able to articulate the value of FastTrack.Experience leading a creative team delivering readiness and documentation for Microsoft partners.Experience in working directly with partner organizations in the delivery of Microsoft cloud services.Understanding of the M365 suite. Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer.
